== SHAPE== 

Draws shapes using the SHAPE sub-dialect

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | shape-cmd-block
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [block!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
&lt;p&gt;For examples of specific SHAPE commands see &lt;u&gt;[[shape|HERE]]&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


== ARC== 

Draws an elliptical arc from the current point.
&lt;TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLSPACING=10&gt;&lt;TR&gt;
&lt;TD WIDTH=45% VALIGN=TOP&gt;
{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | end-point
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | radius-x
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [decimal!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | radius-y
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [decimal!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | angle
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [decimal!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | sweep
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [word!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; |  &quot;positive angle&quot; arc 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | '''sweep'''
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | large
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [word!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | large arc sweep
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | '''large'''
|}
&lt;/TD&gt;&lt;TD WIDTH=25% VALIGN=MIDDLE&gt;
   pen yellow
   line-width 3
   shape [
      move 100x200
      arc 300x200 120 50 0
   ]
&lt;/TD&gt;&lt;TD WIDTH=30% VALIGN=MIDDLE ALIGN=CENTER&gt;
[[image:SARC-1.png|200px]]
&lt;/TD&gt;&lt;/TR&gt;&lt;/TABLE&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Set SWEEP to draw arcs in a &quot;positive-angle&quot; direction:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	pen yellow
	line-width 3
	shape [
		move 100x200
		arc 300x200 120 50 0 sweep
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SARC-2.png |200px]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Set LARGE for arc sweeps greater than 180°:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	pen yellow
	line-width 3
	shape [
		move 100x200
		arc 300x200 120 50 0 sweep large
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SARC-3.png|ARC example 3]]

&lt;br&gt;

&lt;p&gt;More complex usage of '''arc''':&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	pen yellow
	line-width 3
	shape [
		move 0x399
		line 42x357
		arc 84x315 25 20 -45 sweep
		line 126x273
		arc  168x231 25 40 -45 sweep
		line 210x189 
		arc  252x147 25 60 -45 sweep
		line 294x105 
		arc  336x63 25 80 -45 sweep
		line 399x0
		move 0x0 
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SARC-4.png|ARC example 4]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Same complex example but with relative positioning commands:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	pen red
	line-width 3
	translate 0x399
	shape [
		move 0x0
		'line 42x-42 
		'arc 42x-42 25 20 -45 sweep
		'line 42x-42 
		'arc 42x-42 25 40 -45 sweep
		'line 42x-42 
		'arc 42x-42 25 60 -45 sweep
		'line 42x-42 
		'arc 42x-42 25 80 -45 sweep
		'line 63x-63
		move 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SARC-5.png|ARC example 5]]

&lt;br&gt;

== CLOSE== 

Closes previously defined set of lines in the SHAPE block.

This command has no arguments.
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''

&lt;p&gt;In some case it is easier to use the CLOSE command as a shortcut instead of calculating the closing lines.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is without CLOSE commands:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	line-width 3
	pen yellow
	shape [
		move 100x100
		hline 50
		arc 100x50 50 50 0 large
		move 75x75 vline 25 arc 25x75 50 50 0
		move 0x160
		line 200x160 200x0 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:CLOSE-1.png|CLOSE example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;	
&lt;p&gt;And here with CLOSE commands:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;	
	line-width 3
	pen yellow
	shape [
		move 100x100
		hline 50
		arc 100x50 50 50 0 large
		close
		move 75x75 vline 25 arc 25x75 50 50 0
		close
		move 0x160
		line 200x160 200x0 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:CLOSE-2.png|CLOSE example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;

== CURV== 

Smooth '''CURVE''' command shortcut.

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point1
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point2
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point1
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | ...
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
&lt;p&gt;From http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/paths.html:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&quot;The first control point is assumed to be the reflection of
the second control point on the previous command relative to
the current point. (If there is no previous curve command,
the first control point is the current point.)&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Simple example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	line-width 3
	pen yellow
	shape [
		move 100x50
		vline 150
		curv 300x150 300x50
		move 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:CURV-1.png|CURV example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;	
&lt;p&gt;Same example but with relative positioning commands:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;	
	line-width 3
	pen red
	shape [
		'move 100x50
		'vline 100
		'curv 200x0 200x-100
		move 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:CURV-2.png|CURV example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;

== CURVE== 

Draws a cubic Bézier curve.

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point1
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point2
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point3
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point4
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | ...
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
&lt;p&gt;A cubic Bézier curve is defined by a start point, an end point,
and two control points.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
	line-width 3
	pen yellow
	shape [
		move 100x50
		curve 100x150 300x150 300x50
		move 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SCURVE-1.png|CURVE example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;	
&lt;p&gt;Same example but with relative positioning commands:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;	
	line-width 3
	pen red
	shape [
		move 100x50 'curve 0x100 200x100 200x0
		move 0x0
	]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SCURVE-2.png|CURVE example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;

== HLINE== 

Draws a horizontal line from the current point.

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | end-x
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [decimal!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
&lt;p&gt;Using absolute coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen yellow
line-width 4
shape [
    move 100x100
	hline 300
    move 100x150
	hline 250
    move 100x200
	hline 200
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:HLINE-1.png|HLINE example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using relative coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen red
line-width 4
shape [
    move 100x100
	'hline 200
    'move -200x50
	'hline 150
    'move -150x50
	'hline 100
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:HLINE-2.png|HLINE example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;

| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; |

| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | ...
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
&lt;p&gt;Using absolute coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen yellow
line-width 4
shape [
	move 50x50
	line 300x120 50x120 300x50
	move 0x0
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SLINE-1.png|LINE example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using relative coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen red
line-width 4
shape [
	move 50x50
	move 50x50 'line 250x70 -250x0 250x-70
	move 0x0
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:SLINE-2.png|LINE example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;

== MOVE== 

Set's the starting point for a new path without drawing anything.

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point1
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''

&lt;p&gt;The effect is as if the &quot;pen&quot; were lifted and moved to a new
location.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Used at the end of a SHAPE command, MOVE prevents the shape
from being drawn as a closed polygon.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: Every path defined in SHAPE block is automatically closed. To disable the auto-close feature just put at the end of the SHAPE block: '''move 0x0'''&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
line-width 4
pen red
shape [
    move 100x100
    line 20x20 150x50
    move 0x0
]
pen blue
shape [
    move 100x200
    line 20x120 150x150
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:MOVE-1.png|MOVE example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using relative coordinates for the second shape:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
line-width 4
pen red
shape [
    move 100x100
    line 20x20 150x50
    move 0x0
]
pen blue
shape [
    move 100x100
    'move 0x100
    'line -80x-80 130x30
    'move 0x0
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:MOVE-2.png|MOVE example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;


== QCURV== 

Smooth '''QCURVE''' command shortcut.

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Type 
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Description
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Values
|- 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | point1
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | [pair!]
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
| bgcolor=&quot;white&quot; | 
|}
&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
&lt;p&gt;Draws a cubic Bézier curve from the current point to point1.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;See: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/paths.html and CURV&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Using absolute coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen yellow
line-width 4
shape [
	move 0x150
	qcurve 100x250 200x150
	qcurv 400x150
	move 0x0
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:QCURV-1.png|QCURV example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using relative coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen red
line-width 4
shape [
	move 0x150
	'qcurve 100x100 200x0
	'qcurv 200x0
	move 0x0
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:QCURV-2.png|QCURV example 2]]

&lt;br&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A quadratic Bézier curve is defined by a start point, an end

&lt;p&gt;Using absolute coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;

]

[[image:QCURVE-1.png|QCURVE example 1]]

&lt;br&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using relative coordinates:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;code&gt;&lt;pre&gt;
pen red
line-width 4
shape [
	move 100x50
	'qcurve 100x100 200x0
	move 0x0
]
&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/code&gt;
[[image:QCURVE-2.png|QCURVE example 2]]

== VLINE== 

Draws a vertical line from the current point.

{| cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;4&quot; border=&quot;0&quot; style=&quot;background: black; color: black&quot;
! bgcolor=&quot;silver&quot; | Arg

&lt;br&gt;'''Notes and Examples'''
